instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard responding slow
threads.message: We got MacBook Pro Keyboard was not responding and trackpad in first place. I replace trackpad cable and trackpad working now fine but keyboard is not, keys need to be pressed 3-4 times to get one symbol. already tried new trackpad other trackpad cable, new keyboards and  battery didn't help. also I tried fresh osx same didn't resolve issue.Any ideas what should we check ?  Thanks for any help.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard responding slow
threads.message:
Access boot menu and check if left/right arrows move correct there.

Check for corrosion around <CHIP>U4820</CHIP>/30.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R4822</RESISTOR>/23 are good.
